member.name: T:LitDev.LDFastArray
member.summary: This object provides another faster way of storing values in an Array. It can handle 1, 2, 3 and higher dimensional arrays and has methods to read and write arrays to files, including in CSV format. It is also possible for different rows in an array to have different dimensions or numbers of elements (jagged array), just like Small Basic arrays. Internally it uses lists that allow the sizes to grow so that the array dimension or size doesn't need to be set at the start. The indexing is by integer starting from 1. For 1D arrays it is recommended to use LDList since it has additional sort methods. Elements in arrays with dimension greater than 3 are indexed by a comma separated list of indices or index variable names.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDFastArray.Add
member.summary: Create a new array. This is a general array that can be used as a 1D, 2D, 3D or higher dimension array, depending on the data set.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDFastArray.Set(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Set a value. Set1D, Set2D or Set3D methods are marginally faster for lower dimension arrays.
member.param: A comma (or space) separated list of index values (slower) or index variable names (faster). e.g. "3,2,6" or "i,j,k" If this is set to "", then previously set index variables are used.

member.name: T:LitDev.LDUnits
member.summary: A general editable unit conversion system. All units and dimensions are case sensitive. A base unit consists of a single dimension and name, and are all independent. A derived unit consists of a description, name and units definition consisting of base or other derived units, and optional additive term, usually 0. A unit is parsed by separting . / + - and *, then recursively resolving derived unit conversions, bracketed () terms first. Values (especially those with a decimal point '.' or minus '-') should be contained in (). A unit may be prefixed by a prefix or number value (e.g. m is mili 0.001, K is kilo 1000 etc). Any unit may be postfixed by a power. A typical unit may be "mile/hr", "m/s2" or "MJ/day" etc and can be any combination of base and derived units. Any pair of unis that are dimensionally the same can be converted. An additive value is only used for non-compound unit conversions (e.g. C to F). To avoid obscure prefix unit conflicts use a full prefix name (e.g. min could be 60 seconds or 0.001 inches, the latter should be milliin). Currency conversions are updated daily.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDUnits.Convert(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Convert a value from one unit to another.
member.returns: The converted value or "FAILED" (usually non-existant unit or inconsistant dimensions).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDUnits.GetErrors
member.summary: Get an array of error messages if a Convert fails or conflicts are found for added units or constants.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDUnits.GetDimensions(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Get an array of dimensions for a unit.
member.param: The unit to get dimensins of.
member.returns: An array indexed by dimension and value of the dimension power or "".

member.name: M:LitDev.LDUnits.GetBaseUnits
member.summary: Get a list of current base units.
member.returns: An array of available base units, indexed by unit dimension. The array values are the base unit names.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDUnits.GetDerivedUnits
member.summary: Get a list of current derived units.
member.returns: An array of available derived units, indexed by unit name with (description). The array values are the base (or derived units) used for conversion.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDUnits.GetConstants
member.summary: Get a list of current constants.
member.returns: An array of available constants, indexed by constant name with (description). The array values are the constant values.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDUnits.GetPrefixes
member.summary: Get a list of current prefixes.
member.returns: An array of available prefices, indexed by prefix name. The array value is the prefix value.

member.summary: Add a base unit to the system.
member.param: The unit name (be careful it doesn't confict with existing unit names).

member.summary: Add a derived unit to the system.
member.param: An optional long name or description of the derived unit.
The unit name (be careful it doesn't confict with existing unit names).

member.summary: Add a dimensionless constant to the system.
member.param: An optional long name or description of the constant.

member.name: T:LitDev.LDBits

member.returns: The modified number with bit set.

member.summary: Unset a bit in a number.
member.param: The number to unset the bit.
member.returns: The modified number with bit unset.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDBits.GetBit(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Get the bit value in a number.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDBits.Not(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Logically Not a number.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDBits.AndBits(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Logically And 2 numbers.
member.returns: The And number (where both input bits are set).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDBits.OrBits(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)

member.returns: The Or number (where either input bits are set).

member.name: T:LitDev.LDLogic
member.summary: Logic operations. To evaluate an expression for use with these options, use LDMath.Evaluate3. Example: input = 3.1 result = LDLogic.Switch(LDMath.Evaluate3(input+"<5"),"OK","New input required")

member.name: M:LitDev.LDLogic.Not(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: The Not operator. Not("True") = "False" Not("False") = "True"
member.param: The value to operate on ("True" or "False").

member.name: M:LitDev.LDLogic.Or_(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: The Or operator. The trailing underscore is to keep SB parser happy not using reserved keyword OR. Or_("True","True") = "True" Or_("False","False") = "False" Or_("True","False") = "True" Or_("False","True") = "True"

member.name: M:LitDev.LDLogic.And_(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: The And operator. The trailing underscore is to keep SB parser happy not using reserved keyword AND. And_("True","True") = "True" And_("False","False") = "False" And_("True","False") = "False" And_("False","True") = "False"

member.name: M:LitDev.LDLogic.XOr(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: The XOr (exclusive or) operator. XOr("True","True") = "False" XOr("False","False") = "False" XOr("True","False") = "True" XOr("False","True") = "True"

member.name: M:LitDev.LDLogic.LT(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: The less than operator. Checks if value1 is less than value2. It also works for strings, where a lexical comparison is made.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDLogic.LE(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: The less than or equal operator. Checks if value1 is less than or equal to value2. It also works for strings, where a lexical comparison is made.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDLogic.GT(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: The greater than operator. Checks if value1 is greater than value2. It also works for strings, where a lexical comparison is made.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDLogic.GE(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: The greater than or equal operator. Checks if value1 is greater than or equal to value2. It also works for strings, where a lexical comparison is made.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDLogic.EQ(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: The equality operator. Checks if value1 is equal to value2. It also works for strings, where a lexical comparison is made.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDLogic.NE(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: The inequality operator. Checks if value1 is not equal to value2. It also works for strings, where a lexical comparison is made.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDMathX.FFTComplex(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Create an array of complex values from arrays of real and imaginary parts.
member.returns: An array of complex data (real amplitude and imaginary phase), "MISMATCH" or "FAILED". For each complex pair the index is the real part and the value is the imaginary part.

member.name: T:LitDev.LDController
member.summary:
Get input from one or more USB attached game controllers (e.g. gamepad or joystick). If there is more than 1 attached device, then they are numbered from 1.
SlimDX runtme for .Net 4.0 requires to be installed before this object can be used (http://slimdx.org/download.php).

member.name: T:LitDev.LDWaveForm
member.summary:
Create PPM (Pulse Position Modulation) sound signals to control RC (remote control) devices. See http://blogs.msdn.com/b/smallbasic/archive/2014/05/10/smallbasic-pulse-position-modulation-extension.aspx. Additonally create simple sound waveforms, which can be played asynchronously at the same time.
SlimDX runtme for .Net 4.0 requires to be installed before this object can be used (http://slimdx.org/download.php).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDWaveForm.Stop(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Stop a playing sound.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDWaveForm.PlaySineWave(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Play a Sine wave form.
member.param: Duration (ms). If this is negative then the waveform is repeated (-duration) times.
member.returns: The wave name or "" on failure.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDWaveForm.PlaySquareWave(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Play a square wave form.
member.param: Duration (ms). If this is negative then the waveform is repeated (-duration) times.
member.returns: The wave name or "" on failure.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDWaveForm.PlayWave(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Play a user defined wave form.
member.param: Duration (ms). If this is negative then the waveform is repeated (-duration) times.

Form for the repeating wave. This is an array, where the index is an increasing relative time (the actual value is normalised to the frequency) and the value is an amplitude (-1 to 1). Example of a triangular wave would be "0=-1;1=1;2=-1;"
member.returns: The wave name or "" on failure.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDWaveForm.PlayHarmonics(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Play a user defined wave form as a sum of harmonics.
member.param: Duration (ms). If this is negative then the waveform is repeated (-duration) times.

Harmonic amplitudes. This is an array, where the index is a harmonic multiple of the base frequency (2, 3, etc) and the value is the relative amplitude of the harmonic. A square wave can be formed by (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Square_wave): For i = 3 To 21 Step 2 harmonics[i] = 1/i EndFor squareWave = LDWaveForm.PlayHarmonics(256,1000,harmonics)
member.returns: The wave name or "" on failure.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDWaveForm.PlayWavFile(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Play a wav file.
member.param: Duration (ms). If this is negative then the waveform is repeated (-duration) times.
member.returns: The wave name or "" on failure.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDWaveForm.PlayDX7(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Play DX7.
member.param: An array of values for each channel (values between 0 and 1, usually 8 channels).
member.returns: The wave name or "" on failure.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDWaveForm.Volume
member.summary: The volume to play the waveform (0 to 100).

member.name: P:LitDev.LDWaveForm.Pan
member.summary: The left (-100) to right (100) stereo panning, (default 0).

member.name: P:LitDev.LDWaveForm.Loop
member.summary: Continuously loop the sound, "True" or "False" default. Lopping sounds can be stopped by calling Stop method as they are playing.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDWaveForm.Async
member.summary: Play the sound asynchronously (return before sound completes), "True" or "False" default.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDWaveForm.Amplitude
member.summary: Signal amplitude (maximum is 2^15 = 32768, default is 20262).

member.name: T:LitDev.WebAPIFactory
member.summary: This class is a singleton and should be used to generate WebAPI objects

member.name: T:LitDev.WebAPI
member.summary:
A wrapper for some Web Request stuff for Geography, Finances, and other future API's.
We can also be kind to the API's we use through this by allowing restrictions on how frequently our users request information either based on setting time limits on the information.

Inner text for the new node or "".

Where the node is inserted. "Append" - insert at the end of current node's child nodes. "Prepend" - insert at the start of current node's child nodes. "Before" - insert before the current node. "After" - insert after the current node.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDxml.ToArray
member.summary: Convert the current xml document to a Small Basic array. The structure and depth of the array may be quite complex. Each node has optional arrays "Attributes", and "Children" or "Data". If there are are child nodes then they are indexed first by number to deliminate multiple children with the same name.

member.name: T:LitDev.LDFastShapes
member.summary: Shape methods which are faster than standard Small Basic Shape operations. This is primarily for shape movement when there are a large number of shapes updated in a game loop. Only the main Shapes commands are supported since these are the ones that are commonly repeated many times. The shape must first be created, then registered (ShapeIndex) and the returned integer index used with the other methods. The visual update of the changes made does not happen until (Update) is called when all changes are processed together. Performance improvements come from both integer indexing and batch update.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDFastShapes.ShapeIndex(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Register a shape for use with this object. This command is potentially slow, so should be called before time critical visual updates occur. i.e. Create and register all shapes before motion is simulated.
member.param: The name of the created shape.
member.returns: An index to use in the other methods in this object. The index is an integer starting at 1, incremented for each shape registered. -1 for an error.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDFastShapes.Update
member.summary: Update all of the properties of shapes set by this object that have been modifed since the last update. The shapes are not visually updated until this method is called.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDFastShapes.Move(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Moves the shape with the specified name to a new position.
member.param: The index (returned by ShapeIndex) of the shape to move.
The x co-ordinate of the new position.
The y co-ordinate of the new position.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDFastShapes.GetLeft(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Gets the left co-ordinate of the specified shape.
member.param: The index (returned by ShapeIndex) of the shape.
member.returns: The left co-ordinate of the shape.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDFastShapes.GetTop(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Gets the top co-ordinate of the specified shape.
member.param: The index (returned by ShapeIndex) of the shape.
member.returns: The top co-ordinate of the shape.

member.summary: Sets how opaque a shape should render.
member.param: The index (returned by ShapeIndex) of the shape.
The opacity level ranging from 0 to 100. 0 is completely transparent and 100 is completely opaque.

member.summary: Gets the opacity of a shape.
member.param: The index (returned by ShapeIndex) of the shape.
member.returns: The opacity of the object as a value between 0 and 100. 0 is completely transparent and 100 is completely opaque.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDArray.CopyToSBArray(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Copy LDArray type to SmallBasic array type.
The reverse operation (SmallBasic to LDArray) isn't possible becuase the SmallBasic indexes are not necessarily contiguous integers. Note also that a SmallBasic array cannot hold an empty string value, so these will not be copied.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDArray.Sort(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Perform a sort on an LDArray.
By default the sort is by string value, therefore 10 comes before 2. To sort by number value, all values must be a number (or empty).
Empty values are placed at the end of the sort. The input array is replaced by the sorted array.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDArray.Count(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)

member.returns: The number of non-empty values in the array.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDArray.SortIndex(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Obtain an array of the indices in sort order of an array.
By default the sort is by string value, therefore 10 comes before 2. To sort by number value, all values must be a number (or empty).
Empty values are placed at the end of the sort. The input array is unchanged and the index array must be previously created with the same size as the array to sort.
member.param: The array to obtain an index order sort.
An array to hold the index order of the sorted array.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDControls.MediaPlayerStretch(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Set a visual media stretch - how the visual fills its area.
member.param: The stretch method. Available stretch options are: "None" (The content preserves its original size). "Uniform" (The content is resized to fit in the destination dimensions while it preserves its native aspect ratio - Default). "Fill" (The content is resized to fill the destination dimensions. The aspect ratio is not preserved). "UniformToFill" (The content is resized to fill the destination dimensions while it preserves its native aspect ratio, clipping as required).

The first index is the row or node number and the value of the array is the display text at the current node.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDControls.MenuChecked(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)

member.name: M:LitDev.LDControls.AddMenu(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Add a menu control.
member.param:
An array of menu items. The index is the menu display name and the value is the parent display name. The top level display name should be "Main". The names should be unique since they will be returned on click event. A separator is "-", "--", "---" etc since they have to be unique and cannot be selected.
menuList["File"] = "Main" menuList["Open"] = "File" menuList["-"] = "File" menuList["Exit"] = "File" menuList["Help"] = "Main" menuList["Show Help"] = "Help"

An optional array of icon images (URL or ImageList) or "" for none.
iconList["File"] = Program.Directory+"/file.png"

An optional array to identify items as checkable or "" for none. The value is the initial checked state "True" or "False".
checkList["Show Help"] = "True"

member.name: T:LitDev.LDCall
member.summary: Call Functions with arguments, asyncronously from any extension or from a pre-compiled SmallBasic exe.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDCall.Function(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Call a Small Basic Sub as a function with one input argument.
The input arguments(s) will be copied to an array called "args". The result should be put in a variable (may be an array) called "return". The variable "args" should be set to "" at the start of the program. The input parameter(s) are unchanged, while "args" and "return" are set to "" on return.
member.param: An input value (may be an array).
member.returns: The result of the function held in optional variable "return" or an error message.

member.summary: Call any extension method asynchronously. See example LDCallAsync. If dll, extension, obj and arguments are all "", then method may be a subroutine in your SmallBasic program.
member.param: The extension namespace (usually the same as the dll name, e.g. "LitDev" or "MicroSoft.SmallBasic.Library" for SmallBasicLibrary.dll).
An array of arguments or "" for none. A single argument doesn't have to be in an array.
member.returns: "PENDING" or an error message on failure.

member.name: T:LitDev.LD3DView
member.summary:
3D Visualisation in the GraphicsWindow.
Coordinates have the following directions and have no correspondence to the GraphicsWindow coordinates. X - Left(-) to Right(+) Y - Down(-) to Up(+) Z - Far(-) to Near(+)
For more details on the underlying methods see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms747437%28v=vs.90%29.aspx Several of the AddShape methods use HelixToolkit (recompiled and slightly modified for SmallBasic) http://helixToolkit.codeplex.com
Also see LDVector for vector algebra methods.

member.name: M:LitDev.LD3DView.AddView(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Add a 3DView (GraphicsWindow shape).
member.param: A flag to favour speed over quality "True" or "False". "True" removes visual clipping (clip 3DView to input width and height), hit-testing (unused) and anti-aliasing (not needed).

member.name: M:LitDev.LD3DView.AutoControl(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Set auto control of the camera. This mode is a general purpose camera control, mainly for moving within a scene (a flyby mode). Move forwards and backwards with mouse wheel (faster with Shift down, slower with Control down). Yaw and Pitch camera moving with left mouse button. Yaw with A,D or Left,Right keys, move forwards and backwards with W,S or Up,Down keys. Roll camera moving with right mouse button. Double left click an object to center it (Centre of rotation). Double right click to reset the up direction to Y. Yaw and Pitch scene moving with Shift and left mouse button after selecting an object to rotate scene about. X, Y, Z keys change the view direction and up direction to face in these directions towards (0,0,0), with Shift then the negative direction.
member.param: Allow pitch and roll movement, "True" or "False".
Allow the Shift/Control key modifiers for mouse control, "True" or "False".
The distance to view the scene from using keys, (0 prevents the X,Y,Z key shortcuts, -1 also prevents the A,D,W,S and arrow keys).

member.name: M:LitDev.LD3DView.AutoControl2(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Set auto control of the camera. This mode is mainly to rotate and view a 3D scene rather than move through the scene (an inspection mode). Zoom in or out with mouse wheel (faster with Shift down, slower with Control down). Pan left/right with A,D or Left,Right keys, pan up/down with W,S or Up,Down keys. Double left click an object to center it (Centre of rotation). Double right click to reset the up direction to Y. Yaw and Pitch scene moving with left mouse button after selecting an object to rotate scene about. Roll scene moving with right mouse button. X, Y, Z keys change the view direction and up direction to face in these directions towards selected center, with Shift then the negative direction.
member.param: The distance to view the scene from using keys, (0 prevents the X,Y,Z key shortcuts).

member.name: M:LitDev.LD3DView.AddGeometry(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Add a geometry object.
member.param: A space or colon deliminated list of point coordinates.
A space or colon deliminated list of indices for each triangle (counter-clockwise for outward face).
An optional space or colon deliminated list of the outward normals for each node or "".
A colour or gradient brush for the object.
A material for the object. The available options are: "E" Emmissive - constant brightness. "D" Diffusive - affected by lights. "S" Specular - specular highlights.

member.name: M:LitDev.LD3DView.AddImage(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Add an image to a geometry object. A geometry 'skin' may contain several segment images in one image.
member.param: A space or colon deliminated list of the texture coordinates for each node. Each node has 2 values between 0 and 1 indicating the x,y image mapping to the node. The may be defaulted to "" if the texture has previously been set.
The image to load to the geometry. Value returned from ImageList.LoadImage or local or network image file. A colour or gradient brush can also be used here.
A material for the object. The available options are: "E" Emmissive - constant brightness. "D" Diffusive - affected by lights. "S" Specular - additional specular highlights.

member.summary: Add an image to a back surface of geometry object. A geometry 'skin' may contain several segment images in one image.
member.param: A space or colon deliminated list of the texture coordinates for each node. Each node has 2 values between 0 and 1 indicating the x,y image mapping to the node. The may be defaulted to "" if the texture has previously been set.
The image to load to the geometry. Value returned from ImageList.LoadImage or local or network image file. A colour or gradient brush can also be used here.
A material for the object. The available options are: "E" Emmissive - constant brightness. "D" Diffusive - affected by lights. "S" Specular - additional specular highlights.

member.name: M:LitDev.LD3DView.CameraProperties(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Set the angle of view, near and far clipping distances. These are all of the fundamental perspective camera properties.
member.param: The near clipping distance (can improve near object e.g. wall hit detection). A negative value is 0.001 (default is 0.125).
The far clipping distance (can improve performance). A negative value is infinity (default).
The view angle cone of the camera in degrees (affects perspective vanishing point). If this is negative, then an Orthographic (no perspective) camera is used with view width set to -angle).

member.name: M:LitDev.LD3DView.SetCentre(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Set the centre for rotation and scale transformations of a geometry. By default this is the centre of a bounding box for the geometry, often 0,0,0. The centre is defined in the coordinates used to create the geometry. It does not have to be within the geometry. If a coordinate value is set to "", then the default value is used.
member.param: The x coordinate of the centre.
The y coordinate of the centre.
The z coordinate of the centre.

Options to control centre setting. Multiples can be set, e.g. "R1R2R3" to set all rotations. "R1" First rotation transformation "R2" Second rotation transformation "R3" Third rotation transformation "S" Scale transformation

member.returns: An array of dimensions or "FAILED". array[1] = sizeX (width) array[2] = sizeY (height) array[3] = sizeZ (depth) array[4] = X (Xmin) array[5] = Y (Ymin) array[6] = Z (Zmin)

member.name: T:LitDev.LDBlueTooth
member.summary: BlueTooth control. The Advanced features refer to non file transfer (effectively writing a device driver). To communicate with a USB bluetooth stick you also need have an external bluetooth device, setting it to be dicoverable etc before running your SmallBasic program.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDBlueTooth.Initialise
member.summary: Initialise a bluetooth USB stick and detect discoverable external devices. As devices come into or out of range the devices list is updated.
member.returns: "True" or "False" for success or failure configuring a bluetooth interface.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDBlueTooth.GetDevices
member.summary: Get a list of discovered bluetooth devices.
member.returns: An array of devices or "" on failure.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDBlueTooth.GetServices
member.summary: Advanced feature. Get a list of available service protocols.
member.returns: An array of services or "" on failure.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDBlueTooth.GetEncodings
member.summary: Advanced feature. Get a list of available encodings.
member.returns: An array of encodings or "" on failure.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDBlueTooth.Connect
member.summary: Advanced feature. Connect an external device and service to the bluetooth USB stick. You must first Initialise, then set the device, service and encoding.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDBlueTooth.SendData(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Advanced feature. Send data to a bluetooth device. The device must be Initialised and Connected. The encoding should also be set.
member.param: A string of characters to send.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDBlueTooth.ReceiveData
member.summary: Advanced feature. Receive (fetch) data from a bluetooth device. The device must be Initialised and Connected. The encoding should also be set.
member.returns: String of received characters or "" on failure.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDBlueTooth.SendFile(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Send a file to an attached external bluetooth device. You must first Initialise, then set the device.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDBlueTooth.ReceiveFile(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Receive (fetch) a file from an attached external bluetooth device. You must first Initialise, then set the device.
member.param: The location to save the received file.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDBlueTooth.LastDevice
member.summary: The last device in or out of range.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDBlueTooth.LastError
member.summary: Get the last error message. Error messages may be set for various failures.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDBlueTooth.DataAvailable
member.summary: The number of bytes of data received and waiting to be read. This could be used in a Timer to check for data received.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDBlueTooth.Device
member.summary: The current bluetooth device.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDBlueTooth.Service
member.summary: Advanced feature. The current bluetooth service.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDBlueTooth.Encode
member.summary: Advanced feature. The current bluetooth data encoding.

member.name: E:LitDev.LDBlueTooth.InRange
member.summary: Event when a bluetooth device comes in range. Seems to keep firing unexpectedly.

member.name: E:LitDev.LDBlueTooth.OutOfRange
member.summary: Event when a bluetooth device goes out of range. Doesn't seem to work as expected.

member.name: T:LitDev.LDShell

member.name: M:LitDev.LDShell.GetDetail(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Gets the value of an extended property for a given file or folder.
member.param: The full file- or folder path.
The ID number or name of the property (eg. -1="Infotip"/"", 0="Name", 1="Size", etc.) ID numbers and names of available properties under s. 'AllDetails'.

Indizes in speps by 1? "True" or "False" (default, real property ID).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDShell.LinkGetProperty(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Gets properties of a lnk/url shortcut link, like target pfad, arguments etc.
member.param: The full path of the lnk/url shortcut link file.

The property to get (case independent, * for Urls) like: "Target" target path * "Args" arguments "Folder" working directory "Desc" comment * "HotKey" shortcut key comb * (default: 0) "Style" window style * (1 normal, 3 max, 7 min) "Icon" icon path
member.returns: The value of the property if available or "". "FAILED" on failure.

member.summary: Modifies properties of an existing lnk/url shortcut link, like target path, arguments etc. (* for Urls).
member.param: The full path of an existing lnk/url shortcut link file.
* The full path of the target file/-folder resp. URL address.
Startparameter when launching the shortcut or "" (for url).
The full path of the start folder or "" (for url).
* Comment or description for the shortcut or "".
* Full path of the icon file for the shortcut or "".
* Index of the icon in the icon file (default: 0, for .ico).
* keys combination to launch the shortcut link (default: 0).
* Window style when launching the shortcut (default: 1 normal, 3 max, 7 min).
member.returns: The full file path of the modified shortcut on success, else "FAILED".

The full path of the target file/-folder resp. URL address.
member.returns: The full file path of the created shortcut on success, else "FAILED".

member.param: The full path for the new lnk/url shortcut file.
The full path of the target file/-folder resp. URL address.

member.summary: Gets properties of a lnk/url shortcut link, like target pfad, arguments etc. (IWshRuntimeLibrary).
member.param: The full path of the lnk/url shortcut link file.

The property to get (case independent, * for Urls) like: "Target" target path * "Args" arguments "Folder" working directory "Desc" comment * "HotKey" shortcut key comb * (default: 0) "Style" window style * (1 normal, 3 max, 7 min) "Icon" icon path,Idx (default: ,0)
member.returns: The value of the property if available or "". "FAILED" on failure.

member.summary: Modifies properties of an existing lnk/url shortcut link, like target path, arguments etc. (* for Urls) (IWshRuntimeLibrary).
member.param: The full path of an existing lnk/url shortcut link file.
* The full path of the target file/-folder resp. URL address.
Startparameter when launching the shortcut or "" (for url).
The full path of the start folder or "" (for url).
* Comment or description for the shortcut or "".
* The full path (resp. path,Idx) of the icon for the shortcut link or "". 'Idx' is Index of the icon in in the file (default: 0, for .ico).

member.returns: The full file path of the modified shortcut on success, else "FAILED".

member.name: T:LitDev.LDInline
member.summary:
Include C#, VB or JScript code to use at runtime. If multiple namespaces or classes are used, then all method, property or event names should be unique. Alternatively a fully qualified namespace.type.name may be used. Can be used to compile extensions. May also be used with other .Net dlls compiled externally. Method, property, event, class and used references can be obtained (public static only).
The current application assemblies are auto referenced. Depending on .Net methods used additional assemblies may be required. Additional assemblies are referenced by full dll path. Assembly dlls are often found in the following or similar locations: C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v2.0.50727 C:\Program Files (x86)\Reference Assemblies\Microsoft\Framework\v3.0
The TextWindow should be visible prior to using these methods if later use of the TextWindow is required.

member.summary: Include and compile a C# Class(es). Can be the contents of a file read with File.ReadContents().
member.param: An array of any additional assemblies required.
An optional path to create a dll (+xml) output, use "" to perform in-memory.

member.summary: Include and compile a VB Module(s). Can be the contents of a file read with File.ReadContents().
member.param: An array of any additional assemblies required.
An optional path to create a dll (+xml) output, use "" to perform in-memory.

An optional path to create a dll output, use "" to perform in-memory.

member.name: T:LitDev.LDList
member.summary: This object provides a way of storing values like an array that reorders itself as items are added or removed. A list is an efficient array store (much faster than SmallBasic arrays) that can be indexed by integers and perform various other operations. The indexing is automatically updated (indexed from 1) as the list changes.

member.summary: Appends a second list to the end of a first list.

The name of the second list to append to listName1.
member.returns: The number of items in the list or -1 on failure.

member.name: T:LitDev.LDClient
member.summary: Server and Client communication between computers. Separate programs are required for the server and client - this is for the client.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDClient.CheckServer(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Test if a server is available for connection. Do not call this method at a high frequency (> 1 per second).
member.param: The server connection ip:port (e.g. "192.168.1.60:100"). This value is returned by LDServer.Start.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDClient.Connect(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Connect to a server.
member.param: The server connection ip:port (e.g. "192.168.1.60:100"). This value is returned by LDServer.Start.

Enable auto message passing "True" or "False". If this is used (recommended) then all client data is passed via server to all other clients, and no processing of send and receive events is required. The data is updated to arrays of data (indexed by client name) that is returned from the Update methods. The auto option should be the same for server and all clients.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDClient.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnect the client from the server.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDClient.SendMessage(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Send a message to the server.
member.param: The message may be any variable including an array.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDClient.UpdateDynamic(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Update client data when using the auto message passing. This is for small quantities of frequently changing data, like sprite coordinates. this method uses the last updated client data stored on the client and is therefore fast.
member.param: The data for this client to propagate to other clients.
member.returns: An array indexed by client names with current data for all existing clients.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDClient.UpdateStatic(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Update client data when using the auto message passing. This is for larger quantities of infrequently changing data, like client configuration. This method uses data stored and retrieved from the server so may be slower than UpdateDynamic since it waits for server retreived data, guaranteeing that all client data is fully synced.
member.param: The data for this client to propagate to other clients.
member.returns: An array indexed by client names with current data for all existing clients.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDClient.GetClients
member.summary: Get a list of current connected clients.
member.returns: An array of current client names or "" for none.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDClient.Name
member.summary: This client's name. Get or set your name.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDClient.CloseDelay
member.summary: A delay in ms (default 100) when disconnecting to allow a message to be sent before connection closed (Disconnect). This delay should also be set for the server in LDServer.CloseDelay.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDClient.LastServerMessage
member.summary: The last server message.

member.name: E:LitDev.LDClient.ServerMessage
member.summary: Event when the server sends a message to this client.

member.name: E:LitDev.LDClient.Disconnected
member.summary: Event when server disconnects this client.

member.name: T:LitDev.LDServer
member.summary: Server and Client communication between computers. Separate programs are required for the server and client - this is for the server.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDServer.Disconnect(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Disconnect a client.
member.param: The client name, usually Client1, Client2 etc. A list of current clients can be obtained from the method GetClients or found from the ClientConnected event.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDServer.Close(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Disconnect and close (End) a client.
member.param: The client name, usually Client1, Client2 etc. A list of current clients can be obtained from the method GetClients or found from the ClientConnected event.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDServer.SendMessage(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Send a message to a client.
member.param: The client name, usually Client1, Client2 etc. A list of current clients can be obtained from the method GetClients or found from the ClientConnected event.
The message may be any variable including an array.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDServer.Broadcast(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Send a message to all clients.
member.param: The message may be any variable including an array.
member.returns: A array of values "SUCCESS", "NOT_CONNECTED", "NO_CLIENT" or "FAILED" with the Client Name being the index.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDServer.Start(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Start the server.
member.param: Enable auto message passing "True" or "False". If this is used (recommended) then all client data is passed via server to all other clients, and no processing of send and receive events is required. The data is updated to arrays of data (indexed by client name) that is returned from the client Update methods. The auto option should be the same for server and all clients.
member.returns: The current connection parameter ip:port (e.g. "192.168.1.60:100"), or "FAILED". This is the parameter to use to connect from the client.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDServer.GetClients
member.summary: Get a list of current connected clients.
member.returns: An array of current client names or "" for none.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDServer.Stop
member.summary: Stop the current server and close all clients.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDServer.IP
member.summary: The IP address of the server (it is defaulted to the current LAN IP). If you want to use over the internet, then a web IP will be needed.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDServer.Port
member.summary: The windows port to use (default 100).

member.name: P:LitDev.LDServer.CloseDelay
member.summary: A delay in ms (default 100) when disconnecting to allow a message to be sent before connection closed (Stop, Disconnect and Close). This delay should also be set for clients in LDClient.CloseDelay.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDServer.AutoMessages
member.summary: Show TextWindow connection messages when in auto mode "True" (default) or "False".

member.name: P:LitDev.LDServer.LastClient
member.summary: The last client name.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDServer.LastClientConnected
member.summary: The last client connected name.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDServer.LastClientDisconnected
member.summary: The last client disconnected name.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDServer.LastClientMessage
member.summary: The last client message.

member.name: E:LitDev.LDServer.ClientMessage
member.summary: Event when a client sends a message to the server.

member.name: E:LitDev.LDServer.ClientConnected
member.summary: Event when a client connects.

member.name: E:LitDev.LDServer.ClientDisconnected
member.summary: Event when a client disconnects.

member.name: T:LitDev.LDQueue
member.summary: This object provides a way of storing values. It is similar to a stack, except that is is fist-in first-out, like a queue. You can enqueue (add) a value to the end of the queue and dequeue (remove) the first value at the front of the queue. You can only enqueue and dequeue the values one by one.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDQueue.Enqueue(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Adds a value to the end of the specified queue.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDQueue.GetCount(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Gets the count of items in the specified queue.
member.returns: The number of items in the specified queue.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDQueue.Dequeue(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Remove (and get) the value from the front of the specified queue.

member.name: T:LitDev.LDSettings
member.summary: The Settings library consists of helpers that allow programs to store and retrieve user settings.

member.summary: Gets the value for the setting identified by the specified name.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDSettings.SetValue(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Sets a value for a setting identified by the specified name.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDSettings.FilePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the file path for the settings file.

member.name: T:LitDev.LDIOWarrior
member.summary: Access IO-Warrior devices. See http://www.codemercs.com/io-warrior/?L=1

member.name: M:LitDev.LDIOWarrior.Initialise
member.summary: Initialise IO-Warrior devices.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDIOWarrior.Detatch
member.summary: Disconnect all IO-Warrior devices.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDIOWarrior.LastError
member.summary: Get the last system error message. "" for no error (probably only useful for detailed error analysis of underlying system calls).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDIOWarrior.Read(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Read from the IO-Warrior device.
member.param: "True" (return after the state changes) or "False" (return with current state).
The number of bytes to read (if zero, then the ReportSize is used if channel is 0 or SpecialReportSize if channel is 1). See GetReportSize and GetSpecialReportSize.
member.returns: An array of read bytes [0 to 255].

member.name: M:LitDev.LDIOWarrior.Write(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Write to the IO-Warrior device.
member.param: The channel to write to (indexed from 0).
An array of bytes to send [0 to 255]. The array size should be ReportSize for channel 0 and SpecialReportSize for channel 1. See GetReportSize and GetSpecialReportSize.
member.returns: The number of bytes successfully written.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDIOWarrior.GetReportSize(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Get the report size. Number of bytes in a Read/Write. This the report size for channel 0.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDIOWarrior.GetSpecialReportSize(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Get the special report size. Number of bytes in a special Read/Write. This the report size for channel 1.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDIOWarrior.GetName(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Get the device name.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDIOWarrior.GetPID(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Get the device PID.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDIOWarrior.GetVID
member.summary: Get the device VID (Common to all IOWarrior types).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDIOWarrior.GetSerialNumber(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Get the device serial number.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDIOWarrior.GetVersion(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Get the device firmware version.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDIOWarrior.LCDWrite(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Write text to the LCD (untested).

member.name: P:LitDev.LDIOWarrior.Timeout
member.summary: The timeout for read and writes in ms. Default 1000.

member.name: T:LitDev.LDDataBase
member.summary: SQL Database with ListView control. ConnectSQLite for SQLite databases (see http://zetcode.com/db/sqlite for SQLite commands). ConnectMySQL for MySQL databases (see http://www.mysql.com for MySQL downloads and setup). ConnectSqlServer for SqlServer databases (see http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/server-cloud/products/sql-server-editions/sql-server-express.aspx for SqlServer downloads and setup). ConnectOleDb for Access OleDb databases. ConnectOdbc for Odbc databases.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDataBase.GetDB
member.summary: Get a read only list of databases for use outside Small Basic.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDataBase.ConnectSQLite(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Create or open an SQLite database. This must be called before any SQL methods. When a table is created it must have first column as "Id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY".
member.param: The full path to the SQLite database file (usually with extension db).
member.returns: A label to identify the database.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDataBase.ConnectMySQL(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Connect to a MySQL database. This must be called before any SQL methods. The MySQL service must be running and database with credentials already created, if in doubt use SQLite.
member.returns: A label to identify the database.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDataBase.ConnectSqlServer(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Connect to a SqlServer database. This must be called before any SQL methods. The SqlServer service must be running and database with credentials already created, if in doubt use SQLite.
member.returns: A label to identify the database.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDataBase.ConnectOleDb(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Connect to an Access OleDb database. This must be called before any SQL methods. The Access OleDb service must be running and database with credentials already created, if in doubt use SQLite.
member.returns: A label to identify the database.

member.summary: Connect to an Odbc driver connected database. This must be called before any SQL methods. The Odbc service must be running and database with credentials already created, if in doubt use SQLite.
member.param: The Odbc option number to control the Odbc connection (e.g. 0 or 3).
member.returns: A label to identify the database.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDataBase.AddListView(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Add a ListView to view database query results. This is a read only display of query results.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDataBase.Command(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Perform an SQLite, MySQL, SqlServer. OleDb or Odbc command (not a query) on a database. If this database is viewed in a dataview then unsaved user changes will be lost when the dataview is updated following this operation.
member.param: The existing database label (see ConnectSQLite, ConnectMySQL, ConnectSqlServer, ConnectOleDb or ConnectOdbc).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDataBase.Query(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Perform an SQLite, MySQL, SqlServer, OleDb or Odbc Query (not a command) on a database.
member.param: The existing database label (see ConnectSQLite, ConnectMySQL, ConnectSqlServer, ConnectOleDb or ConnectOdbc).
The SQL Query. Example "SELECT * FROM myTable;".
A ListView to populate with the query result or "" for none.
Optionally return an array of results ("True" or "False"). Remember large multi-dimensional arrays in Small Basic are slow.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDataBase.EditTable(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Display a database table for editing in a LDControls.DataView control. Using this method the database is bound to the dataview conrol, reflecting the database.
member.param: The existing database label (see ConnectSQLite, ConnectMySQL, ConnectSqlServer, ConnectOleDb or ConnectOdbc).
The table name to view and edit.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDataBase.SaveTable(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Commit any changes made in a LDControls.DataView to the database.
member.param: The existing database label (see ConnectSQLite, ConnectMySQL, ConnectSqlServer, ConnectOleDb or ConnectOdbc).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDataBase.SaveTableBySQL(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Commit any changes made in a LDControls.DataView to the database. This is an alternative to SaveTable, where the data binding fails for some reason. This method may be slower than SaveTable, since it recreates the table line by line using SQL.
member.param: The existing database label (see ConnectSQLite, ConnectMySQL, ConnectSqlServer, ConnectOleDb or ConnectOdbc).

member.name: P:LitDev.LDDataBase.Connection
member.summary: Over-ride an SQL database connection string (advanced use only). Set before connection to database, when this connection string will be used in place of the entered connection parameters. Default is "" (unused).

member.name: T:LitDev.LDEncryption
member.summary: Encryption and hash methods.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDEncryption.RSAEncrypt(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Encrypt an RSA message. Requires a Public key to be set (Anyone can encrypt with public key). If no key is set then one created for this session is used.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDEncryption.RSADecrypt(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Decrpyt an RSA message. Requires a Private key to be set (Only originator can decrypt with private key). If no key is set then one created for this session is used.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDEncryption.RSASign(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Sign an RSA message. Requires a Private key to be set (Only originator can sign with private key). If no key is set then one created for this session is used.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDEncryption.RSAVerify(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Verify a signed RSA message. Requires a Public key to be set (Anyone can verify with public key). If no key is set then one created for this session is used.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDEncryption.RSAReset
member.summary: Randomly reset the private and public keys

member.name: M:LitDev.LDEncryption.AESEncrypt(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Encrypt some text using AES encryption and a password key. The encrypted text can be saved to a file. Note that if you forget the password there is NO WAY to decrypt!
member.param: The password key for the encryption.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDEncryption.AESDecrypt(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Decrypt an AES encrypted cypher (previously encrypted) using a password key.
member.param: The password key for the encryption.
member.returns: The original unencrypted text or "" if password and cypher don't match.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDEncryption.MD5Hash(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Create an MD5 hash of a text input (http://wikipedia.org/wiki/MD5). This 32 character hash is recommended where a general or shorter hash is required (password or data integrity).
member.param: A text or password to create a hash.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDEncryption.MD5HashFile(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Create an MD5 hash of a file. This 32 character hash is for file data integrity checks (e.g. a file contents is unchanged).
member.param: The full path to a file to get the hash.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDEncryption.SHA512Hash(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Create a SHA2-512 hash of a text input. This 128 character hash is recommended for the most secure password encryption.
member.param: A text to create a hash (often a password).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDEncryption.SHA512HashFile(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Create an SHA512 hash of a file. This 128 character hash is for file data integrity checks (e.g. a file contents is unchanged).
member.param: The full path to a file to get the hash.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDEncryption.RSAPublicKey
member.summary: Get or set a public RSA key.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDEncryption.RSAPrivateKey
member.summary: Get or set a private RSA key.

member.name: T:LitDev.LDText
member.summary: Text manipulations.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDText.Split(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)

The text to replace the found text.

member.summary: Get all occurances of a subtext in some text.

member.summary: Get the height in pixels that text will be displayed in the GraphicsWindow with the current font. The GraphicsWindow must be open to use this method.

member.name: T:LitDev.LDHID
member.summary: USB control for HID (Human Interface Devices). The VID and PID (4 character hex codes) for the device are required. Only HIDs will work using these methods. Hopefully this includes most game controllers, simple robotic devices and sensors.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDHID.InputLength(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Get the input record length for a HID device.
member.returns: The number of bytes in the input record.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDHID.OutputLength(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Get the output record length for a HID device.
member.returns: The number of bytes in the output record.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDHID.Output(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Send data to the HID device. This must be an array of bytes (0 to 255). The array must be indexed from 1 and have size OutputLength.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDHID.AddDevice(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Add a HID connected device from its VID and PID. The VID and PID are 4 character (hex) values, and can be found from: Device Manager->Properties->Details->Hardware ids For example: HID\VID_046D PID_C215 REV_0204 has VID "046D" and PID "C215". Only add a device once.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDHID.GetBits(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Get an 8 element array of 1s and 0s indicating which bit of a byte are set.
member.returns: An 8 element bit array (small bit first) or "" on failure.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDHID.SetBits(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Set a byte from an 8 element array of 1s and 0s indicating which bit of a byte are set.
member.param: An 8 element array of 1s and 0s (small bit first).
member.returns: A byte number (0 to 255) or -1 on failure.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDHID.FindDevices
member.summary: List all found HID (Human Interface Devices).
member.returns: A 2D array of all found devices. The first dimension is the found device indexed from 1. The second dimension is "VID", "PID" and "Description" holding the hex values of VID, PID and a device description.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDHID.LastInput
member.summary: An array of the last HID input data. This a set of values from 0 to 255 (bytes).
member.returns: An array of input data or "" for none.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDHID.LastDevice
member.summary: The last HID device that had input.

member.name: E:LitDev.LDHID.Input
member.summary: Event when the HID input changes.

member.name: E:LitDev.LDHID.Removed
member.summary: Event when the HID device is removed.

member.name: T:LitDev.LDScrollBars
member.summary:
GraphicsWindow ScrollBars - can be used for a scrolling game.
Warning - Do not alter the GraphicsWindow size using GraphicsWindow.Width or GraphicsWindow.Height AFTER scrollbars have been added. In this case use LDGraphicsWindow.Width and LDGraphicsWindow.Height.
For large scrolling regions see Rasterize property.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDScrollBars.Add(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Add Scroll Bars to the GraphicsWindow. The input width and height are those that can be scrolled to. A value of 0 prevents a scrollbar appearing.
member.param: The width of the scrollable region.

member.summary: Rasterize drawables "True" (default) or "False". When more than 100 objects are drawn (not Shapes) SmallBasic will rasterise these to an image for performance reasons. member.name: M:LitDev.LDTextWindow.SetColour(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Replace one of the standard TextWindow colours. There are 16 available colours, by default they are indexed 0 to 15: Black (0), DarkBlue (1), DarkGreen (2), DarkCyan (3), DarkRed (4), DarkMagenta (5), DarkYellow (6), Gray (7), DarkGray (8), Blue (9), Green (10), Cyan (11), Red (12), Magenta (13), Yellow (14), White (15). Note that you can still use TextWindow.BackgroundColor and TextWindow.ForegroundColor to use the new colours (with the original colour names), alternatively the colours can be selected using LDTextWindow.SetColours from the indices. The colours must be set using either method before they are applied.
member.param: The stanadard colour index colour to replace.
Any colour to replace a standard colour with.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDGraphicsWindow.TransparentGW
member.summary: Create a transparent GraphicsWindow. This must be the called before any other GraphicsWindow, Controls or Shapes methods that create a window. To see anything you must add something to the transparent GraphicsWindow. For example, create a non-rectangular window using a transparent border png with LDShapes.BackgroundImage. The transparency can be altered with GraphicsWindow.BackgroundColor. Sometimes less than 100% transparency can be required (e.g. to register mouse movements).

member.summary: Fill a region surrounding a specified pixel. All neighbour pixels of the same colour are changed. This only applies to the drawing layer of the GraphicsWindow.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDGraphicsWindow.SetActive
member.summary: Set the GraphicsWindow as active (has focus).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDGraphicsWindow.Reposition(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Scale and move all Shapes and Controls within the GraphicsWindow. This method resizes and moves the view rather than the shapes, so their positions and other properties remain unchanged but appear scaled within the repositioned region. For example Shapes.GetLeft remains unchanged although the view has been repositioned and GraphicsWindow.MouseX reports the coordinates relative to the repositioned view. Imagine the entire view is repositioned as if it were a shape inside the GrapicsWindow. The transformation between view coordinates (vX,vY) and GraphicsWindow coordinates (gwX,gwY) is: gwX = (vX+panX)*scaleX + gw*(1-scaleX)/2 gwY = (vY+panY)*scaleY + gh*(1-scaleY)/2 All drawing remains within the original GraphicsWindow.
member.param: The X direction scaling of the view.
The Y direction scaling of the view.
Pan the view in the X direction in the view scaling, 0 is centered in the GraphicsWindow.
Pan the view in the Y direction in the view scaling, 0 is centered in the GraphicsWindow.
An angle to rotate the view.

member.summary: Scale and move all Shapes and Controls within the GraphicsWindow, by smooth animation. This is the same as the Reposition method except that the movement is animated.
member.param: The X direction scaling of the view.
The Y direction scaling of the view.
Pan the view in the X direction in the view scaling, 0 is centered in the GraphicsWindow.
Pan the view in the Y direction in the view scaling, 0 is centered in the GraphicsWindow.
An angle to rotate the view.
The time for the animation, in milliseconds.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDGraphicsWindow.RepositionPoint(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Get coordinates transformed between GraphicsWindow and a repositioned View (See Reposition).
member.param: Transfer from View to GraphicsWindow ("True") or from GraphicsWindow to View ("False").
member.returns: A 2D array of transformed coordinates indexed by 1 and 2.

member.summary: A tolerance for FloodFill method (0 to 100). 0 is default and only pixels of exactly the same colour are changed, 100 changes all pixels apart from new fill colour.

Create additional GraphicsWindows.
All variables are shared between windows (global scope). GraphicsWindow events must be registered for each window, but the event subroutine can be shared. All other events can be registered once as normal. All commands or methods apply to the current active window, set using CurrentID. The original or default GraphicsWindow has id 0.

member.name: T:LitDev.LDEmail
member.summary: Email Methods.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDEmail.Send
member.summary:
Send an email. The default Smtp client is "smtp.gmail.com" and the default port is 587. The following and other email clients may also work. "smtp.live.com" (Hotmail) "smtp.mail.yahoo.com"
A minimum of the "From, Password and Recipient" properties must be set first. The "From" and "Password" properties should be your email credentials for the client. Additionally you should set the "Subject and Body" properties. The "Attachment" property may be optionally set to a full file path, "" for no attachment.
No more than 1 email per minute can be sent.
member.returns: "" for success or an error message.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDEmail.Port
member.summary: SMTP port (default 587).

member.summary: SMTP server (default "smtp.gmail.com").

member.summary: Modify an image to show a gray scale (or modified image if texture is set) shadow effect based on a normal map image.
member.param: An image shape normal map (R,G,B colours represent normal vecors of a 3D image). This is an image shape created using Shapes.AddImage containing the normal map image.
The x position of a light source relative to the image.
The y position of a light source relative to the image.
The z position of a light source relative to the image, this is the height abouve the image. This can be used to alter the effective contrast of the shadow effect.
An optional ImageList image or "" with texture (colour) to modify, it should be the same dimensions as the normal map image. The texture image may be changed on subsequent calls.
Optional ambient light intensity if texture is set (default 0.3).
Optional light intensity if texture is set (default 2).

member.name: T:LitDev.LDMatrix
member.summary: A 2-Dimensional matrix structure that can be used to solve linear equations or other methods. An error will result in a return value "FAILED";

member.name: M:LitDev.LDMatrix.Create(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Create a matrix object. Row and column matrices can be defined with rows = 1 or cols = 1 respectively.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDMatrix.Delete(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Delete an existing matrix (not generally required, but can save memory if lots of matrices are created).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDMatrix.SetValue(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Set value in matrix.
member.param: The row at which to add the value (indexed starting from 1).
The column at which to add the value (indexed starting from 1).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDMatrix.GetValue(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Get value in matrix.
member.param: The row at which to get the value (indexed starting from 1).
The column at which to get the value (indexed starting from 1).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDMatrix.CopyNew(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Copy one matrix to a new matrix.
member.returns: A copy of the matrix or "FAILED".

member.name: M:LitDev.LDMatrix.Copy(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Copy one matrix to an existing matrix. The dimensions of the 2 matrices must be the same.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDMatrix.Add(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Add two matrices, the number of rows and columns of the 3 matrices given must be the same. Alternatively, if the second matrix is a scalar number then it is added to each element of the first matrix.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDMatrix.Multiply(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Multiply two matrices, the number of columns of the first and rows of the second matrix must be the same. The number of rows and columns of the result matrix must be the rows of the first and columns of the second. Alternatively, if the second matrix is a scalar number then it is multiplied by each element of the first matrix and the dimensions of the first and result must be the same.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDMatrix.Inverse(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Calculate the inverse of a matrix (using Gaussian Elimination). The number of rows and columns of the matrix and inverse must be the same (square matrices). A singular matrix returns "SINGULAR" and the inverse matrix will be incorrect.
member.param: The matrix to invert (unmodified by inversion).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDMatrix.Transpose(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Calculate the transpose of a matrix. The number of rows and columns of the matrix and transpose must be reversed (cols = rows and vice versa).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDMatrix.View(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: View a matrix for dubugging purposes.
member.param: The matrix display will pause all other actions until it is closed. ("True" or "False").

member.name: M:LitDev.LDMatrix.CopyToSBArray(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Copy LDMatrix type to SmallBasic array type.
The reverse operation (SmallBasic to LDMatrix) isn't possible becuase the SmallBasic indexes are not necessarily contiguous integers.

member.name: T:LitDev.LDMusic
member.summary: Extends the Sound.PlayMusic method to include a variety of instrument sounds. Also, multi-channel music can be created. Due to the large number of instrument names, it is easy to miss the following properties: Instrument, Velocity, Volume, Pan and Channel.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDMusic.PlayMusic(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Plays musical notes.
member.param: A set of musical notes to play. The format is a subset of the Music Markup Language supported by QBasic.

example.code: LDMusic.Instrument = LDMusic.Xylophone LDMusic.PlayMusic("O5 C8 C8 G8 G8 A8 A8 G4 F8 F8 E8 E8 D8 D8 C2")

member.name: M:LitDev.LDMusic.PlayMusic2(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Plays musical notes with specified instrument and MDI channel. Also set volume, pan (balance) and velocity (key hit speed).
member.param: A set of musical notes to play. The format is a subset of the Music Markup Language supported by QBasic.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDMusic.PlayNote(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Play an individual note (allows multi-channel instruments).

member.summary: Stop a note being played.
member.param: The note to stop (this is the value returned by PlayNote when the note was started).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDMusic.Reset
member.summary: Reset (stop all music on all channels).

member.name: P:LitDev.LDMusic.Velocity
member.summary: Set the key velocity (1 to 128). This is how hard a key was pressed (default 100).

member.name: P:LitDev.LDMusic.Pan

member.name: T:LitDev.LDWebCam
member.summary: Provides access to a webcam.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDWebCam.Start(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Start a webcam display object (SmallBasic shape). If this is called more than once, multiple copies af the same webcam image are be generated.
This object can be moved, zommed, rotated etc using the standard Shapes methods.
Maximum resolution usually at 640 x 480 pixels, smaller may be faster.
member.param: The width of the webcam display object.
The height of the webcam display object.
member.returns: The name of the webcam display object.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDWebCam.End
member.summary: End the webcam display, call this before removing the webcam shape.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDWebCam.Snapshot
member.summary: Take a snapshot and save it as a jpg with a SaveAs dialog.

member.summary: Take a snapshot and save it to a file.

member.name: T:LitDev.LDDebug
member.summary: Debugging utilities.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDebug.Start
member.summary:
Start a debugging session, usually do this as the first line of your program.
Usually you would either set break points manually in your code before running (LDDebug.Break) or auto add breakpoints (LDDebug.Instrument).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDebug.Instrument(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Create a SmallBasic file (_debug.sb) with break points auto added for each line.
Just open and run the new instrumented file to debug it. When a problem is found, correct it in your original and re-instrument to debug the corrected file.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDebug.Break(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Set a break point, where the program will pause and variable values can be viewed.
member.param: An identification label for the breakpoint. A unique label should be chosen for each breakpoint defined. There are some known limitations with breakpoints inside event subroutines.
