member.name: T:LitDev.LDStatistics
member.summary: Performs statistics on a 1D array of data.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDStatistics.SetArray(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Set a 1D array of numbers to perform some statistics on.
This command must be called before any statistics are calculated.
member.param: The array to perform statistics on.
member.returns: An array of the data sorted.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDStatistics.DistNormal(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Create an array with a Normal distribution.
member.param: The standard deviation of the distribution.
member.returns: A 1D array of the Normal distribution (Array[x] = y).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDStatistics.DistBinomial(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Create an array with a Binomial distribution.
This is like the probablity of getting k heads from 20 (n) coin tosses, with a probablity for each toss getting a heads of 0.5 (p).
member.param: The probablity of success for each try.
member.returns: A 1D array of the Binomial distribution, probablity of k successes (Array[k] = y).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDStatistics.DistUniform(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Create an array with a Uniform distribution.
member.returns: A 1D array of the Uniform distribution (Array[x] = y).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDStatistics.DistTriangular(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Create an array with a Triangular distribution.
member.returns: A 1D array of the Triangular distribution (Array[x] = y).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDStatistics.Integrate(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Calculate the integral of a 1D data array.
member.returns: A 1D array of the Integral of the input array.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDStatistics.Differentiate(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Calculate the derivative of a 1D data array.
member.returns: A 1D array of the Derivative of the input array.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDStatistics.InterpolateY(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Interpolate a 1D data array to find the value of y(x).
The values of x should be monotonically increasing.
member.param: The value of x (may be an array of x values).
member.returns: The interpolated value y or an array of y values.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDStatistics.InterpolateX(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Interpolate a 1D data array to find the value of x(y).
The values of y should be monotonically increasing with x.
member.param: The value of y (may be an array of y values).
member.returns: The interpolated value x or an array of x values.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDStatistics.Frequency(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Calculate a frequency distribution from array of data.
member.param: The array to create the frequency distribution from.
The number of bins spanning the data.
Is the frequency normalised to integrate to 1 ("True" or "False").

member.summary: Convert an ANSI encoded text file to UTF8. It should also work for any other encoding. UTF8 is the default text file encoding used by Small Basic.
member.param: Include Byte Order Mark (BOM) in UTF8 file ("True" or "False", no BOM is usual).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDFile.ReadANSI(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Read an ANSI encoded text file. It should also work for any other encoding including UTF8. UTF8 is the default text file encoding used by Small Basic.
member.returns: The contents of the file or "" for failure (the encoding may not have been detected correctly).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDFile.ReadANSIToArray(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Reads a text file with ANSI encoding into an array with one element for each line in the file. It should also work for any other encoding including UTF8. Blank lines are included as an element in the array with one blank space.
member.param: The full path of the file.
member.returns: An array with one element for each line in the file or "" for failure (the encoding may not have been detected correctly).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDFile.WriteByteArray(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Writes an Array of bytes to an (existing) file.
member.param: The full path of the file. A non existing file will be created.
The 1D Array (from 1, continously) with byte values [0,255]. A single comma or sapce separated variable may also be used using hex notation, eg 3D,1F,00.
The byte position (incl., from 1) in an existing file to start writing (ignored for non existing file, will be written from beginning). <=1, from file start >file length, append after file end
member.returns: The number of written bytes on success, else "FAILED".
member.example: '(over)writes from file start WriteByteArray(path, arr, 1) 'SB after 4th byte WriteByteArray(path, "1=83;2=66;3=169;",5)

member.summary: Read a file into an array of bytes [0,255].
member.param: The full path of the file.
If this varaible is set to "True", then a single comma deliminated variable of hex values is returned in place of an anrray..
member.returns: An array of byte values indexed from 1, or single string variable of hex values, or "FAILED".

Character to use in place of empty values in the imported array when reading CSV files. A SmallBasic array cannot hold an empty value i.e. "".

member.name: T:LitDev.LDDateTime
member.summary:
Time and Date conversion.
The date format is "25/01/2012 22:18:52", the time part is optional. The date part will be dependent on your locale, e.g. in US it will be "01/25/2012 22:18:52".
An OADate is the number of days (and part days) since 30 December 1899, allowing dates to be added or subtracted.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDateTime.Now
member.summary: The current date and time.
member.returns:
The current date and time.
The format is "25/01/2012 22:18:52", the time part is optional. The date part will be dependent on your locale, e.g. in US it will be "01/25/2012 22:18:52".

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDateTime.NowOADate
member.summary: The current OADate.
member.returns: The number of days (and part days) since 30 December 1899 (OADate).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDateTime.Add(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Calculate a date from input date and an offset in days.
member.returns:
A date equivalent to the input date + offset.
The format is "25/01/2012 22:18:52", the time part is optional. The date part will be dependent on your locale, e.g. in US it will be "01/25/2012 22:18:52".

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDateTime.Subtract(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Calculate a number of days between two dates.
member.returns: The number of days (and part days) between the dates (date1-date2).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDateTime.ToOADate(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Convert date string to OADate.
member.param:
The date string to convert.
The format is "25/01/2012 22:18:52", the time part is optional. The date part will be dependent on your locale, e.g. in US it will be "01/25/2012 22:18:52".
member.returns: The number of days (and part days) since 30 December 1899 (OADate).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDDateTime.FromOADate(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Convert OADate to date string.
member.param:
The OADate to convert.
The number of days since 30 December 1899 (OADate).
member.returns:
The date string.
The format is "25/01/2012 22:18:52", the time part is optional. The date part will be dependent on your locale, e.g. in US it will be "01/25/2012 22:18:52".

member.summary: Get if a key is down. Useful for simplified keyboard game control.

member.summary: Get an array of available font names.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDUtilities.IsNumber(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Test if the input will be treated by SmallBasic as a number. This is a culture invariant number, e.g. "3.14", but not "3,14" or "24x".

member.name: M:LitDev.LDUtilities.GetCurrentCultureNumber(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Get a number expressed in the current culture. A number must be culture invariant in order to be treated as a number in calculations. A current culture number is how it is input or output. For example "3.14" is culture invariant, while "3,14" is French culture.
member.returns: The number expressed in the current culture or input on failure.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDGraph.Help
member.summary:
This function is just to display this help.
Graphs of data can be plotted as lines, points or histograms.
Each series of data is a SmallBasic array with the array index reprenting the (unique) X value and the array value representing the Y value.
For example: data[1] = 5 data[2] = 8 data[3] = 3
First create a graph object with AddGraph, then add series with AddSeriesLine, AddSeriesHistogram or AddSeriesPoints.
Once a graph is created and plotted, the axes can be grabbed and scrolled where the hand cursor appears. The legend can also be moved.
The graph can be rescaled by using the left mouse button to select a region to zoom, or the mouse wheel can be used to zoom the display. A double click will reset the scaling to the original default.
A right click will bring up a menu with other features like export of image or data, displaying the cursor coordinates, hiding the legend etc.
Finally the various parmeters for this method give further control of the plotting colours and behaviour.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDGraph.CreateTrend(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Create a trend from data.
member.param:
An array holding the X and Y coordinate data.
For example, a line with points (0,1) and (2,3) would have data[0] = 1 data[2] = 3
More generally data[x] = y.
The polynomial order for the trend line. 1 is linear. 2 is quadratic.
member.returns: A data array holding a trend that may be plotted.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDGraph.TrendCoef
member.summary: Get the polynomial trend line coefficients for the last calculated trend using CreateTrend.
member.returns: An array 'coef' of the polynomial coefficients for the trend line. The number of coefficients in the array is one larger than the order used to create the trend (order+1) and is indexed from 0. y = coef[0] + coef[1]x + coef[2]x^2 ...

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.Help
member.summary:
This function is just to display this help.
The extension uses Box2D (http://box2d.org) as an engine and provides an interface between it and the graphics capabilities of SmallBasic.
Only shapes that are connected to the physics engine take part in the motion physics, for example you may add normal shapes (e.g. a gun and not connect it to the physics engine). Once a shape is connected to the engine, it is best to only interact with it through the methods provided by the extension. All positions are in the SmallBasic GraphicsWindow pixels and refer to shape centres.
Image and text shapes are treated as rectangles, and ellipses as circles; there is also triangle and convex polygon support, but not lines. Images may be treated as circles by setting the property LoadImagesAsCircles to "True".
One issue that Box2D has difficulty with is small fast moving objects that can 'tunnel' through other shapes without being deflected (see the SetBullet option).
Another problem is shapes of very different size and hence mass, especially large shapes when they are connected together. It may be necessary to modify the density for these (the Anchor options are an attempt to automate this a bit), otherwise the default density of 1 is good. Resist the temptation to connect too many shapes together.
It may be possible to improve the stability of some 'difficult' models using the TimestepControl settings, but the defaults look good for most cases.
Do not call the physics methods inside SmallBasic event subroutines directly, rather set flags that can be processed in a main game loop.
There are sample SmallBasic programs and a Getting Started Guide that comes with the extension dll - this is the best place to start.
Report bugs and problems to the SmallBasic forum (http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/smallbasic/threads), but first simplify your SmallBasic code to isolate the issue before providing a short 'runnable' code sample.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.PanView(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Pan the camera view, including window boundaries.
member.param: Pan in the horizontal direction (negative is left).
Pan in the vertical direction (negative is up).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.GetPan
member.summary: Get the current pan offset, see PanView, FollowShapeX(Y) and BoxShape. World coordinates = screen coordinates + pan offset.
member.returns: A 2 element array with the current pan offset.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.FollowShapeX(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Set a shape to remain stationary at X position in the view. This is similar to PanView, except that the view pans automatically to keep the specified shape at a constant visual X location. Only one shape can be followed in X direction. To unset shape following, set the shapeName to "".

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.FollowShapeY(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Set a shape to remain stationary at Y position in the view. This is similar to PanView, except that the view pans automatically to keep the specified shape at a constant visual Y location. Only one shape can be followed in Y direction. To unset shape following, set the shapeName to "".

member.summary: Move a tire shape, apply a forward or backward force.
member.param: The force to apply, positive is forward, negative is backward.

member.summary: Apply a brake to a tire shape.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.TurnTire(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Turn a tire shape, steer left or right.
member.param: The torque, rotation force to apply, positive is turn right, negative is turn left.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.GetTireProperties(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Get tire properties, they include:
AntiSkid (higher value reduces skid) Drag (higher value increases forward/backward drag) Brake (higher value increases braking power) Straighten (higher value restores steering more quickly) BrakeStraighten (higher value restores steering more quickly while braking)
member.returns: An array of properties, indexed by the property name, e.g. "AntiSkid".

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.SetTireProperties(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Set tire properties, they include:
AntiSkid (higher value reduces skid) Drag (higher value increases forward/backward drag) Brake (higher value increases braking power) Straighten (higher value restores stearing more quickly) BrakeStraighten (higher value restores stearing more quickly while braking)
member.param: An array of one or more properties to set. The index is one of the properties (case sensitive) and the value is the property value.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.GetTireInformation(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Get tire information, it includes:
Skid (if this value exceeds the property AntiSkid, then the tire is skidding) Crash (the value is the speed of the impact)
member.returns: An array of information, indexed by the information name, e.g. "Skid".

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.AddExplosion(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Make an explosion, which consists of 50x20kg particles blast apart over 500ms.
member.param: The X coordinate of the explosion.
The Y coordinate of the explosion.
The explosion force, this is the initial velocity of the blast particles.
A damping for the blast, the smaller this value the larger the blast range (default 10).
An optional colour of the explosion particles ("" for none).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.ToggleMoving(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Toggle a moving shape to be fixed and vice-versa. This method also sets the rotation to be on or off to match if it is moving or fixed.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.ToggleRotation(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Toggle a shape to not rotate and vice-versa. This method toggles the rotation property for fixed and moving shapes.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.ToggleSensor(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Toggle a shape to act as a sensor and vice-versa. A sensor shape does not interact with other shapes, but still provides collision data.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.AttachShapesWithJoint(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Connect two shapes to move together as one with one of several joint types. These can be advanced and require reference to Box2D manual. In many cases it is best to prevent shape rotation for the joints to behave as desired. Multiple joints may also be applied to shapes. The methods use the initial shape positions, so set these first.
member.param:
One of the following joint types.
"Distance" - maintain a fixed distance between the shapes. "Gear" - link Prismatic or Revolute joints (previously created) of 2 shapes. "Line" - move the shapes along a line initially connecting the shapes. "Mouse" - move the shape to follow the mouse (both shape names should be the same). "Prismatic_H" - move shapes vertically along a line between the two shapes. "Prismatic_V" - move shapes horizontally along a line between the two shapes. "Pulley" - a pulley system, one shape moves up as the other moves down - position the shapes initially at the extreme points of the pulley motion. "Revolute" - the shapes can rotate about each other.
The connected shapes can interact with each other "True" or "False" (default).

Optional parameters (default ""), multiple parameters are in an array.
"Distance" - damping ratio (default 0) "Gear" - gear ratio, first joint, second joint (default 1, auto detect joints) "Line" - X direction, Y direction, lower translation, upper translation (default line connecting shapes, no limits) "Mouse" - max acceleration, damping ratio (default 10000, 0.7) "Prismatic_H" - X direction, Y direction, lower translation, upper translation (default 1,0, no limits) "Prismatic_V" - X direction, Y direction, lower translation, upper translation (default 0,1, no limits) "Pulley" - pulley ratio (block and tackle) (default 1) "Revolute" - lower angle, upper angle (default no limits)

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.DetachJoint(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Disconnect two shapes that were previously joined with a joint.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.SetJointMotor(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Set a motor for selected joints (Line, Prismatic_H, Prismatic_V and Revolute).
member.param: The maximum motor force (torque for Revolute). A zero value turns motor off.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.WakeAll
member.summary: Wake all sleeping shapes - shapes sleep due to no applied forces or contacts. They wake automatically on any contact or applied force, so this action is rarely required.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.RayCast(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Cast an invisible ray to detect the proximity of shapes.
member.param: The shape to cast the ray from.
The angle in degrees to check, this can also be an array of angles.
member.returns: An array of results, indexed by the shape name ("Wall" for a static obstacle) with a value equal to its distance. The shapes are sorted to list them nearest first. If an array of input angles is used, then only the nearest shape for each angle is returned and the value is the angle, not the distance.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.WriteJson(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Write out a json script compatible with R.U.B.E. from current LDPhysics model. See https://www.iforce2d.net/rube for more details.
member.param: The full path to the json file to create.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDPhysics.ReadJson(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Read in a json script compatible with R.U.B.E. and create a LDPhysics model. See https://www.iforce2d.net/rube for more details.
member.param: The full path to the json file to read.
Reverse the Y direction up to down ("True" or "False").
Set all shapes to be initially at rest, joint motors are still enabled ("True" or "False").
Add an x coordinate offset to all shapes.
Add a y coordinate offset to all shapes, especially useful when reverseY is set.
member.returns: A text array containing the LDPhysics commands used to create the model.

member.param: The selected animated image number (indexed from 1).

member.name: M:LitDev.LDShapes.AnimationCount(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Get the number of images in an animated image.
member.returns: The number of images in the animated image.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDShapes.AnimationPause(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Pause an animated image. Paused images can still be updated using AnimationSet

member.name: M:LitDev.LDShapes.AnimationResume(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Resume a previously paused animated image.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDShapes.GetAllShapesAt(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Get an array of all of the shapes (if any) at the specified coordinates. The coordinates could be the mouse coordinates for example.
member.returns: An array of shape names or "False". For multiple shapes, the returned array is ordered from top visual layer to bottom.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDShapes.AnimateOpacity(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Set a shape to animate opacity, flash (fade out and in).
member.param: The shape or control to flash.
The interval in ms for a complete flash cycle. A value of 0 will stop the flashing.
The number of flashes. A value of 0 will flash continuously.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDShapes.AnimateRotation(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Set a shape to animate rotation (rotate continuously).
member.param: The shape or control to rotate.
The interval in ms for a complete 360 degree rotation. A value of 0 will stop the rotation. A value less than 0 will rotate anti-clockwise.
The number of rotations. A value of 0 will rotate continuously.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDShapes.AnimateZoom(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Set a shape to animate zooming (in and out).
member.param: The shape or control to zoom.
The interval in ms for a complete zoom cycle. A value of 0 will stop the zooming.
The number of zoom cycles. A value of 0 will zoom continuously.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDShapes.SetShapeEvent(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Register a shape to record mouse events: MouseDown, MouseUp, MouseEnter, MouseLeave, GotFocus and LostFocus.
member.param: The shape or control to add.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDShapes.GetAllShapes
member.summary: Get an array of all currently created shapes.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDShapes.GetOpacity(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Gets the opacity of a shape.
member.returns: The opacity of the object as a value between 0 and 100. 0 is completely transparent and 100 is completely opaque.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDShapes.ZoomAll(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Zoom all shapes.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDShapes.Skew(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Skews the shape with the specified name by the specified angles.
member.param: The name of the shape to skew.
The angle to skew the shape in the X direction.
The angle to skew the shape in the Y direction.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDShapes.FastMove(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Moves the shape with the specified name to a new position. This method is maximally optimised for speed.
member.param: The name of the shape to move.
The x co-ordinate of the new position.
The y co-ordinate of the new position.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDShapes.OverlapDetail
member.summary: Following a call to an Overlap method, this property provides additional detail abut the intersection. Result may be one of: "Empty" - no intersection "FullyContains" - shape1 is completely inside shape2 "Intersects" - overlap but neither is fully contained "FullyInside" - shape2 is completely inside shape1

member.name: P:LitDev.LDShapes.AnimationInterval
member.summary: The update interval for animated images in ms (default 100). A value of zero will pause all animated image updates, for example allowing AnimationSet to set images as required. This is an internal timer that applies to all animated images that are not paused or completed a non-repeating cycle.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDShapes.LastEventShape
member.summary: The last shape for which an event occured (ShapeEvent).

member.name: P:LitDev.LDShapes.LastEventType
member.summary: The last shape event type which an event occured (ShapeEvent). May be one of the following. "MouseDown" "MouseUp" "MouseEnter" "MouseLeave" "GotFocus" "LostFocus"

member.name: E:LitDev.LDShapes.ShapeEvent
member.summary: Event when a shape event occurs to a registered shape (SetShapeEvent)

member.name: M:LitDev.LDSpeech.Vocabulary(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Set a vocabulary of words and phrases for the speech regonition to use. If this is unset, then a large language vocabulary is used and the results will generally be less good (unusable). Also distinct phrases can have a better recognition than single words.
member.param: An array of words or phrases to be recognised. If it is empty, then the default language vocabulary is used.

member.summary: Speed of speech (-10 to 10).

member.summary: Text of the last speech spoken (and recognised) by the computer.

member.name: P:LitDev.LDSpeech.LastSpokenConfidence
member.summary: The last speech spoken detection confidence of correctness (0 to 1).

member.name: E:LitDev.LDSpeech.Listen
member.summary: Event when speech is spoken (and recognised) by the computer. A good microphone, lots of training or consise dictionary are needed to get decent results.

member.summary: Evaluate a string expression to a number or boolean (if possible). The JScript command 'eval' is used and may therefore allow more complex JScript manipulations (also see LDInline). member.param: The expression to evaluate, e.g. "(9/6) + 3" or "2.1 > 1.5".

member.summary: Evaluate a string expression to a number (if possible). An alternative to Evaluate that behaves nicely with the TextWindow.

member.name: M:LitDev.LDMath.Evaluate3(Microsoft.SmallVisualBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Evaluate a string expression to a boolean "True" or "False" (if possible). An alternative to Evaluate that behaves nicely with the TextWindow.
member.param: The expression to evaluate to a boolean, e.g. "21.3 > 16".

member.name: T:LitDev.Engines.Defines
member.summary: Die Klasse IowKitFunctions kapselt die Funktionen der IowKit.dll. Die Klasse IowKitDefines kapeslt die Konstanten der Iowkit.dll

member.name: M:LitDev.Engines.Functions.IowKitOpenDevice
member.summary: Die Metode IowKitOpenDevice ffnet alle am USB erkannten IO-Warrior-Bausteine und liefert ein Handle fr den zuerst gefundenen IO-Warrior zurck.
member.returns: Handle fr IO-Warrior oder null bei Misserfolg.

member.name: M:LitDev.Engines.Functions.IowKitCloseDevice(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Die Methode IowKitCloseDevice schliet den IO-Warrior der durch das gegebene Handle kontrolliert wird.

member.name: M:LitDev.Engines.Functions.IowKitGetProductId(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Fordert die Produkt-Identitt (PID) des IO-Warrior Bausteines ab, der durch das gegebene Handle kontrolliert wird.

member.name: M:LitDev.Engines.Functions.IowKitGetNumDevs
member.summary: Zhlt und nummeriert die am USB angeschlossenen IO-Warrior Bausteine.

member.name: M:LitDev.Engines.Functions.IowKitGetDeviceHandle(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Die Methode IowKitGetDeviceHandle arbeitet liefert zu dem Gert mit der angegebenen Nummer ein gltiges Handle. Vorrausgesetzt, das Gert mit der Nummer existiert. IowKitGetDeviceHandle funktioniert nur nach einem erfolgreichen Aufruf von IowKitDeviceOpen. Erst dann sind alle Bausteine nummeriert.
member.returns: Ein gltiges Handle fr das Gert oder 0 bei Misserfolg.

member.name: M:LitDev.Engines.Functions.IowKitGetRevision(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Liefert die Version der IoWarrior-Firmaware zurck. Die oberen 2 Byte sind immer 0. Es sind 4 Hex-Stellen gltig. Wre die gegenwrtige Softwareversion 1.0.2.1 so wird 0x1021 zurckgegeben. ltere IO-Warrior, die keine eigene Seriennummer haben, liefern eine Versionsnummer kleiner 1.0.1.0 zurck.
member.returns: Die Softwareversion des IO-Warriors oder 0, wenn kein gltiges Handle bergeben wurde.

member.name: M:LitDev.Engines.Functions.IowKitGetSerialNumber(System.IntPtr,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Liest die Seriennummer aus dem durch ein gltiges Handle gesteuerten IO-Warrior heraus.
member.param: Verweis auf ein Datenfeld, dass die Seriennummer speichert. Der Stringbuilder muss zuvor instanziert worden sein.
member.returns: True, wenn die Seriennummer erfolgreich im angegebenen Datenfeld abgelegt werden konnte. False, wenn das Handle ungltig war, der IO-Warrior keine Seriennummer hat oder das Abspeichern der Nummer im bergebenen Ziel fehlgeschlagen ist.

member.name: M:LitDev.Engines.Functions.IowKitRead(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.Byte[],System.UInt32)
member.summary: Liest Daten vom IO-Warrior. Die Funktion blockiert den aufrufenden Thread bis eine nderung an den Eingngen des IO-Warriors durch den Baustein regisriert wird. Ein nicht blockierendes Lesen kann ber den Aufruf von IowKitReadNonBlocking() erfolgen. Die Daten kommen in Form eines Reports an. Nhere Beschreibung der Reports ist im Datenblatt des jeweiligen IO-Warriors zu finden.
member.param: Datenkanal, aus dem gelesen werden soll. Reicht von 0 bis IOWKIT_MAX_PIPES-1
member.returns: Anzahl tatschlich eingelesener Bytes oder 0 bei Misserfolg.

member.name: M:LitDev.Engines.Functions.IowKitReadNonBlocking(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.Byte[],System.UInt32)
member.summary: Liest Daten vom IO-Warrior. Der aufrufende Thread wird nicht blockiert, wenn keine Daten zur Verfgung stehen, also keine nderung an den Eingngen des IO-Warriors stattgefunden hat.
member.param: Datenkanal, aus dem gelesen werden soll. Reicht von 0 bis IOWKIT_MAX_PIPES-1
member.returns: Anzahl tatschlich eingelesener Bytes oder 0 bei Misserfolg.

member.name: M:LitDev.Engines.Functions.IowKitReadImmediate(System.IntPtr,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Liest den Pinstatus der Eingnge des angeschlossenen IO-Warriors direkt aus. Die Funktion gibt True zurck, wenn zuvor eine nderung an den Pins durch den Baustein registriert wurde. Gleichzeitig is im Ziel-Datenfeld ein Abbild der Eingnge als Wert verfgbar. Achtung!!: Diese Funktion arbeitet nicht mit dem IO-Warrior 56 zusammen. Der Baustein gibt mehr als 32-Bit zurck.
member.param: Ziel-Datenfeld fr das Abspeichern der Pin-Zustnde.
member.returns: True bei Erfolg, False wenn keine neuen Daten erfasst wurden oder das bergebene Handle nicht funktioniert.

member.name: M:LitDev.Engines.Functions.IowKitSetTimeout(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Legt die Grenze fr eine Zeitberschreitung beim Lesezugriff auf den IO-Warrior fest. Ein Timeout whrend einer laufenden, noch nicht beendeten Leseaktion fhrt zu Datenverlust (Reports gehen verloren). IowKitRead() schlgt fehl, wenn nicht innerhalb der gegebenen Grenze Daten vom IO-Warrior eingelesen werden knnen. Bei Zeitberschreitung mssen alle vor bis zu dem Zeitpunkt bereits gesendeten aber noch nicht ausgefhrten Aktionen erneut bermittelt werden (z.B. I2C-Bus schreiben oder lesen).
member.param: Grenze fr Zeitberschreitung in Millisekunden. Empfohlen in der iowkit.dll-Beschreibung sind 1000ms oder mehr.
member.returns: True bei Erfolg oder False bei Fehlschlag.

member.name: M:LitDev.Engines.Functions.IowKitSetWriteTimeout(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Legt die Grenze fr eine Zeitberschreitung beim Schreibzugriff auf den IO-Warrior fest. IowKitWrite() schlgt fehl, wenn Daten nicht innerhalb der vorgegebenen Grenze geschrieben werden knnen. Schreibfehler sind untypisch. Verbindungen und Hardware nher prfen, wenn Fehler auftreten.
member.param: Grenze fr Zeitberschreitung in Millisekunden. Empfohlen in der iowkit.dll-Beschreibung sind 1000ms oder mehr.
member.returns: True bei Erfolg oder False bei Fehlschlag.

member.name: M:LitDev.Engines.Functions.IowKitCancelIo(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Beendet alle laufenden Datentransferaktionen auf dem angegebenen Datenkanal(Pipe). Der Einsatz dieser Methode erfordert im Regelfall einen eigenen Thread, da eine beipsielsweise laufende IowKitRead()-Funktion den aufrufenden Thread blockiert, bis eine Rckgabe empfangen werden konnte.

member.name: M:LitDev.Engines.Functions.IowKitWrite(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.Byte[],System.UInt32)
member.summary: Schreibt "length" Bytes in den durch "numPipe" angegebenen Datenkanal des IO-Warriors. Wird etwas anderes als ein gltiger Report, bestehend aus einer korrekten Anzahl von Bytes und einer vom gewhlten Datenkanal akzeptierten Report-ID, gesendet, schlgt die Funktion fehl.
member.param: Puffer, der die zu schreibenden Daten bereistellt.
member.returns: Bei erfolgreicher Durchfhrung ist die Anzahl geschriebener = Anazahl zu schreibender Bytes.

member.name: M:LitDev.Engines.Functions.IowKitGetThreadHandle(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gibt den Handle des Threads zurck, der zum Lesen der I/O-Pins des IO-Warriors genutzt wird. Linux nutzt keie Threads um die Funktionen des IO-Warriors einzubinden und gibt daher immer 0 zurck.
member.returns: Handle fr den laufenden Thread oder 0 bei Misserfolg.

member.name: M:LitDev.Engines.Functions.IowKitVersion
member.summary: Gibt die Version der iowkit.dll als string zurck.

member.name: M:LitDev.Engines.Functions.IowKitSetLegacyOpenMode(System.UInt32)
member.summary: ffnet einen IOWarrior40 dessen Firmware Revision lter 1.0.1.0 ist. Diese Bausteine haben keine Seriennummer die ausgelesen werden kann.

member.name: T:LitDev.Finances.Engine
member.summary: This is the abstraction layer for LDFinance we can change the source of the information hopefully without changing the public API for LDFinance API Documentation is stored here: https://api.tiingo.com/documentation/general/overview
